About me

mathing, coding, writing and autodidact

I’m Thi, a Vietnamese guy who has a curious mind. As an never-stop-learning mathematician, I am interested in researching and sharing contents about applied maths with its applications, computer science and software tools which are helpful to human life. I have a Ph.D. degree in Applied Mathematics at Université Sorbonne Paris Nord, France.

After my Ph.D., I worked at Dataswati as a Data Scientist, a company who helps Food&Beverage Industries more efficient today and more resilient to climatic. I am currently looking for a job as a Data Scientist.

I use this website and this one to document everything I learned while going through the process of learning and working in this field. I also like to write about intuitive maths. I’m an admin of Math2IT, a Vietnamese community about maths, education, and technology.

My hobbies are drawing, reading and cooking.

Most proud of
math2it.com
My notes
My learning log

Data Science note taking

I’ve started to learn to be a data engineer / data scientist from the field of numerical analysis (my Github repository).

  • 1/2020 - 11/2020 — Data Scientist at Dataswati (end probationary period because of economic problem). My role was to ameliorate the library popai, a tool Dataswati uses to work on their projects. I worked much on Time Series, Clutering, Anomaly Detection and Data Processing. I also worked on Data Controller (a tool Dataswati built for connecting everything - Dev, Data, Research, Frontend, Backend).
  • certificate DeepLearning.AI TensorFlow Developer Specialization (4 courses) aught by Laurence Moroney on Coursera.
  • certificate Deep Learning specialization (5 courses) given by deeplearning.ai on Coursera — my notes.
  • certificate Leveraging Cloud-Based Machine Learning on Google Cloud Platform: Real World Applications on LinkedIn Learning.
  • certificate Data Scientist path on Dataquest.
  • certificate IBM Data Professional Certificate (9 courses) on Coursera. – my notes.
  • certificate Learn Python 3 on Codecademy.
  • certificate Learn SQL on Codecademy.
  • certificate Introduction to Stats with Numpy on Codecademy.
  • certificate Machine Learning course on Coursera taught by Andrew Ng.

Web Development note taking

I’ve totally learned by myself, created website Math2IT and designed some websites.

  • 2020 - now
    • Master on creating a website with GatsbyJS.
  • 2019
    • Following Web Development path on Codecademy & keep designing some templates.
    • Create note.dinhanhthi.com, a jekyll theme specialized for note taking.
    • Create simple-perso, a simple and beautiful personal jekyll theme.
  • 2018 — I learned to write a Wordpress theme from screatch and created math2itwp which is a beautiful Wordpress theme.
  • 2014 - 2017 — I started to learn Jekyll and how to create a static website. I created NoteTheme (a theme for note taking purposes) and TaniaJekyll (a beautiful personal theme).
  • 2013 - 2014 — I created Math2IT under Blogger platform and was building up my knowledge about web development.
  • 2012 — Self-studying about Web-development (HTML, CSS, DOM, JS, PHP & MySQL, HTTP Live Streaming)

Learning Maths

I have learned math since the beginning of my study life and keep writing about math under an intuitive way.

  • 2018 - today — I keep studying about maths, especially about its application in life. I write about it on Math2IT (in Vietnamese) under an accessible and intuitive way so that Vietnamese people no longer see maths as useless.
  • 2014 - 2018 — Ph.D. researcher in applied maths at LAGA, Université Sorbonne Paris Nord.
  • 2012 - 2014 — I learned different applied maths topics in France-Vietnam master 2.
  • 2008 - 2012 — I learned to be a maths teacher at Ho Chi Minh City University of Pedagofy.
  • 2005 - 2008 — I learned advanced maths at Ben Tre high school which is a school for gifted students.

Ph.D. Research

I researched on the growth of biofilm by using Finite Element Method, Level Set Method and some other numerical ones for an interface problem. For the implementation and simulation, I first used FreeFem++ and later developed by myself the NXFEM, a Matlab toolbox.

  • 3 presentations about biofilm growth model & numrical methods & application of FreeFem++.
  • 6 conferences about biofilm & biology & numerical methods.
  • 1 additional project proposed by IFPEN in 11th Semaine d’Étude Maths-Entreprises (SEME).
